com.firebase.simplelogin

Class SimpleLogin

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.firebase.simplelogin.SimpleLogin

  • public class SimpleLogin
extends Object
    Firebase Java Simple Login Library. Entry point for the Firebase simple login library. Attach an event listener to the .info/authenticated location to get notifications on changes in authentication state. 
    
 Firebase f = new Firebase("https://example.firebaseio.com/");
 f.child(".info/authenticated").addValueEventListener(new ValueEventListener() {
  @Override
  public void onDataChange(DataSnapshot arg0) {
    System.out.println("auth!: " + arg0.getValue());
  }

  @Override
  public void onCancelled() {
  }
 });
    Use the checkAuthStatus() method to retrieve the FirebaseSimpleLoginUser object of the logged in user. 
    
 SimpleLogin simpleLogin = new SimpleLogin(f, this);
 final SimpleLoginAuthenticatedHandler simpleLoginAuthenticatedHandler = new SimpleLoginAuthenticatedHandler() {
  @Override
  public void authenticated(FirebaseSimpleLoginError error, FirebaseSimpleLoginUser user) {
    System.out.println("Error: " + error);
    System.out.println("User: " + user);
    System.out.println("3rdP: " + user.getThirdPartyUserData());
  }
 };
 simpleLogin.checkAuthStatus(simpleLoginAuthenticatedHandler);
    Author:
    Firebase

        public SimpleLogin(com.firebase.client.Firebase ref,
           android.content.Context context)
        Simple Login constructor; pass an Activity, Context, or Service to enable saving of user tokens between app launches.
        Parameters:
        ref - Firebase reference against which to login.
        context - Android context used to save tokens.

      • SimpleLogin

        public SimpleLogin(com.firebase.client.Firebase ref,
           android.content.Context context,
           SimpleLoginOptions options)
        Simple Login constructor; pass an Activity, Context, or Service to enable saving of user tokens between app launches. Also, include
        Parameters:
        ref - Firebase reference against which to login.
        context - Android context used to save tokens.
        options - SimpleLoginOptions instance for advanced configuration.

      • checkAuthStatus

        public void checkAuthStatus(SimpleLoginAuthenticatedHandler handler)
        Check the authentication status. If there is a previously signed in user, it will reauthenticate that user.
        Parameters:
        handler - Handler for asynchronous events.

      • loginWithFacebook

        public void loginWithFacebook(String appId,
                     String accessToken,
                     SimpleLoginAuthenticatedHandler completionHandler)
        Login to Firebase using a Facebook token. The returned FirebaseSimpleLoginUser object will contain pertinent Facebook data accessible with getThirdPartyUserData().
        Parameters:
        appId - Facebook app id.
        accessToken - Access token returned by Facebook SDK.
        completionHandler - Handler for asynchronous events.

      • loginWithGoogle

        public void loginWithGoogle(String accessToken,
                   SimpleLoginAuthenticatedHandler completionHandler)
        Login to Firebase using a Google access token. The returned FirebaseSimpleLoginUser object will contain pertinent Google data accessible with getThirdPartyUserData().
        Parameters:
        accessToken - Access token returned by Facebook SDK.
        completionHandler - Handler for asynchronous events.

      • loginWithTwitter

        public void loginWithTwitter(String oauth_token,
                    String oauth_token_secret,
                    Long user_id,
                    SimpleLoginAuthenticatedHandler completionHandler)
        Login to Firebase using a Twitter token. The returned FirebaseSimpleLoginUser object will contain pertinent Twitter data accessible with getThirdPartyUserData().
        Parameters:
        oauth_token - Twitter oauth token.
        oauth_token_secret - Twitter token secret.
        user_id - Twitter numeric user id.
        completionHandler - Handler for asynchronous events.
